node.title: 'The country is divided':Â Could border closures impact the federal election?
node.alt: A woman waits for family members to arrive at Sydney airport
node.description: Many in Australia lost family members during India's brutal second wave of coronavirus, while Australians living overseas say they feel abandoned by the federal government.
node.content:
["Reena Anita Rana could\u00a0not bring herself to celebrate Diwali, the Hindu festival of lights, this year.\u00a0", "The Melbourne woman's mother, Anita, died in Delhi during India's severe second wave of COVID-19,\u00a0after Ms Rana's application for an exemption to travel to India had been rejected.", "In May, the federal government announced a two-week ban on returning travellers from India,\u00a0with penalties of up to\u00a0five years' imprisonment or a $66,000\u00a0fine, or\u00a0both.", "\"During the time when the Health Minister was considering whether to make the determination, India was reporting more than 300,000 cases per day,\" a spokesperson for the Health Department told the ABC.", "\"The entry of travellers from India posed a significant risk of COVID-19 entering, establishing and spreading in Australia.\"", "Ms Rana, who runs the Indian Women in Australia group on Facebook, said many in the Indian diaspora had suffered similar experiences\u00a0and that there remained a lot of anger and hurt in the community.", "", "
Reena was unable to see her mother Anita before she passed away.(Supplied)
", "\"It's hard to understand. Who is this government, that's not letting me go? Not letting me fly to my mum,\" she said.", "After Ms Rana separated from her partner last year, she had hoped her mother might be able to visit Australia and help with childcare.", "\"That was my last support,\" she said.", "Gabriela D'Souza, a senior economist at the Committee for Economic Development of Australia, also lost a parent during the pandemic.", "When her father passed away suddenly in June 2020 in Goa, India, Australia's border closures made it extremely difficult to travel there\u00a0\u2014 even before the complete shutdown of travel to and from the subcontinent.", "\"It\u00a0took [the government] almost two weeks to approve my travel exemption and by that point, my dad was already buried,\" Ms D'Souza said.", "\"So I didn't get to attend his funeral or have that healing time with my family.\"", "", "
Ms D'Souza says India was treated differently to the UK and US, despite them all having high rates of COVID-19.(Supplied)
", "A spokesperson for the Department of Home Affairs told the ABC that in response to the COVID-19 outbreak in India, \"the government stepped up engagement with Indian communities\", with Immigration\u00a0Minister Alex Hawke meeting with community leaders in April, May and June.", "\"The department is aware of how deeply the community has been affected by the pandemic,\"\u00a0they said.", "\"We count on community leaders to support the government's messaging on health matters related to COVID-19 to help keep the community safe and connected.\"\u00a0", "
'Fundamental right' to come home denied
", "Prior to the pandemic, there were estimated to be more than 1 million Australians living abroad.", "Kevin Chang is one of them, having worked as an international human rights lawyer in Geneva since 2018.", "He has been fully vaccinated since June 2021 and has travelled through 20 countries in Europe during its summer months.", "", "
Many Australians remain unable to return home.(Reuters: Jaimi Joy)
", "But Mr Chang\u00a0has not been able to come home to visit family and friends because\u00a0he was concerned he would not be allowed to return to his career overseas.\u00a0", "Despite borders reopening, he is still unable to return due to prohibitively expensive flights.", "\"I have been wanting to return to Sydney since mid-2020,\" he said.", "\"The freedom to enter and leave your own country is a fundamental right that should not have been arbitrarily denied.\"", "According to the Australian Bureau of Statistics (ABS), more than 7.6 million people living in Australia in 2020\u00a0\u2014 30 per cent of the population\u00a0\u2014\u00a0were born overseas.", "\"People born in England continue\u00a0to be the largest group of overseas-born residents, accounting for 980,000 people,\" ABS director of migration statistics, Jenny Dobak, said in April.", "\"Those born in India became the second largest group in 2020 with 721,000 people.\"", "For Ms D'Souza, the complete shutdown of travel from India but not England, the US or \"many other countries who also had really high rates\" of COVID-19\u00a0was\u00a0a double standard.", "Mr Chang said he was disappointed \"such draconian policies\" had gone \"pretty much unchallenged by other political parties\".", "", "
Mr Chang says the border closures are a violation of fundamental human rights.(Supplied)
", "In May, Greens senator Mehreen Faruqi described the threat of jail time for Australians returning from India as \"absolutely horrific and racist\".", "But Australia's border closures have generally enjoyed support across the political spectrum throughout the pandemic.", "\"Australian xenophobia has usually manifested in the form of racism against Asians, Africans and Muslims,\"\u00a0Mr Chang said.", "Ipsos polling data released in December 2020 showed that 83 per cent of Australians agreed with the statement: \"Our international borders should be closed, not allowing anyone in or out.\"", "", "
Qantas A380 superjumbo jets resume flying for first time since 2020.
", "
Being locked out 'traumatic' for many
", "Nichola Calvani is a veterinary scientist working in Ireland and one of the co-founders of Reconnect Australia, a group that advocates for the rights of people impacted by border closures.", "", "
Nichola Calvani has been apart from her husband Harry for almost a year.(Supplied)
", "\"Then\u00a0you think about all the people who are essentially locked in\u00a0\u2014 temporary residents and visa holders\u00a0\u2014 who have been part of Australia's COVID response, frontline workers,\u00a0who are technically allowed to leave now, but aren't allowed back in.\"", "The ABC understands 15,193 Australian citizens and 5,744 permanent residents have returned to Australia between November 1 and 16 after the\u00a0easing of border restrictions.", "Dr Calvani said with New South Wales, Victoria and the ACT reopened to fully vaccinated incoming passengers from overseas without quarantine, \"the conversation had moved on\", but that families in other states were still some way off being reunited.", "\"It's quite traumatic for a lot of people as well, and I think it has left a lot of people feeling completely abandoned and forgotten about.", "\"We've sort of been treated as though we're not as deserving of protection from the virus as the rest of Australians\u00a0\u2026 [that]\u00a0we're not as deserving of spending time with our families, or jobs, or security.\"", "The ABC has approached the\u00a0Department of Foreign Affairs for comment.", "
Potential political fallout
", "As vaccination rates against COVID-19 reach high levels and lockdowns in most parts of Australia have lifted, the\u00a0attention is turning towards the federal election\u00a0in the coming months.", "", "
When is the next Australian federal election?
", "Ms D'Souza said there needed to be greater representation of multicultural Australia\u00a0in parliament to avoid decisions that harm migrant communities in the future.", "Mr Chang agreed, adding, \"the lack of cultural diversity and skills cuts across all major Australian parties\", so he did not believe\u00a0migrants' votes would \"necessarily swing one way or another\".", "Ms Rana said May's harsh border closures would cast a long shadow and \"definitely\" influence how Indian Australians vote.", "\"We need to be vaccinated, we are happy to adjust, do everything that is right as a community, but taking [away] our right to see our parents, to see our family? No one should have control of that other than us,\" she said.", "Ms D'Souza said she knew many people \"who haven't yet had that opportunity to grieve their loved ones around family\".", "But she also believed by election time, people might be on their way to understanding why the decision was made and therefore give the government some leeway.", "Francesco Ricatti, deputy director of the\u00a0Monash Migration and Inclusion Centre, said \"the country is quite clearly divided\", but\u00a0was not convinced the border closures would \u00a0\"push people away from their ideological faultlines, or their other interests.\"", "", "
Dr Ricatti says while many people are upset about the border closures, it is unlikely to sway the federal election.(Supplied)
", "\"For example, you might be concerned about not being able to see your parents, but you might also be a migrant who has a business and want to make sure that the economy is solid,\" he said.", "\"And of course now we're starting to see the reopening of the borders, so people have hope.\"", "While more and more Australians are\u00a0booking trips to see family abroad,\u00a0for Ms Rana, the loss of her mother means a visit to India is too painful.", "", "
COVID cases surging across several European countries
"]
